intro: Tetratheca chapmanii, commonly known as the Chapman's tetra-theca, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its showy, four-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with small, narrow leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is adapted to dry conditions and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
